thread.title: Fundraiser set for family of Iraq war vet killed in June car crash
thread.title_full: Fundraiser set for family of Iraq war vet killed in June car crash | cleveland.com

author: Mary Kilpatrick, Northeast Ohio Media Group
title: Fundraiser set for family of Iraq war vet killed in June car crash
text:
MIDDLEBURG HEIGHTS, Ohio — Friends and family will gather this month to celebrate a Marine Corps veteran killed in a June car collision and raise money for his family.
Brian T. Hollingsworth, 36 , who served in the Iraq War, died June 30 when a bread truck struck him on I-480 eastbound near the exit to Ohio 237. Hollingsworth's car was stopped in the breakdown lane, and the truck was traveling in the right lane when it struck him, Fairview Park police said.
The Middleburg Heights husband and father of three girls enlisted following the Sept. 11 attacks, according to a 2003 article published in The Plain Dealer.
Hollingworth worked as a mortgage-lending agent for Howard Hanna in Bay Village at the time of his death. His wife, Melissa, works at the Strongsville Howard Hanna office, which is organizing the event.
The fundraiser will run 2–6 p.m. Sept. 19 at the Berea fairgrounds, and will feature corn hole, face painting, door prices and crafts for kids. Tickets cost $20 for adults, and $5 for children over three. Hot dogs, chips and pop are included.
